summary: Provides an LDAP‑based attack module that first checks the rights of a compromised account, harvests directory data when privileges are limited, and, when sufficient rights are present, creates AD objects (users, computers, DNS records) and alters group memberships to promote the attacker to Domain Administrator. Includes utilities for handling Microsoft managed password blobs and constructing security descriptors.
business_intent: Enable attackers to leverage stolen credentials to enumerate and manipulate Active Directory via LDAP, automating privilege escalation and domain takeover for malicious penetration testing or red‑team operations.
